intro: Rhodanthe cremea, commonly known as the cream everlasting or cream everlasting daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Australia. It is a member of the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, pale yellow to cream-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It produces a compact, bushy growth habit with narrow, linear leaves. Rhodanthe cremea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
